result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Casey Jeffrey Heitzmann was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1.
Concurrent with any other current Probation. 
Defendant to report to Probation today September 11, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: with any other current probation

AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Matthew L Hartung, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Casey J. Heitzmann appeared.  Court called at 10:28 a.m.  State files a DJOC for 14CF212 Ct. 1.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO Contest to Ct 1 in 14CF212.   Court uses testimony from the Motion Hearing.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and stays the adjudication upon full performance of the DJOC.    DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 in 14CF518.  Court reviews the drafted probable cause to find factual basis.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 in 14CF518.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, Ct 3 & Ct. 4 in 14CF212 & Ct. 1 in 14CF518.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:


Ct. 2 14CF518 
- W/S 1 year probation to run concurrent with any other current probation 
 - Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment
- Court costs of $243.00
- DE to report to probation today 09/11/15
- Bail to remain in effect until DE has signed up for probation
- 20 days to appeal


Court reviews the DJOC with the DE.
Court approves and signs the 24 month DJOC for Ct. 1 in 14CF212.
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Casey J. Heitzmann appeared.  Court called at 2:07 p.m.  Includes case 14CF518 & 14CF212.  Attorney Kucinski advises the court there is an agreement.  ADA Nieskes advises he sitting in for ADA Hartung and needs a recess to review the files.  Recess at 2:08 p.m.  Case recalled at 2:11 p.m.  Attorney Nieskes advises there is an agreement would like to set out for Plea/Sentencing.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 2:13 p.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 10:15 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Casey J. Heitzmann appeared.  Court called. Includes 14CF212 (PTC) & 14CF518 (arraignment).
